Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi

Class MailSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi.Resource
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi.MailSession
  • public final class MailSession
extends Resource
    A mail session resource. Corresponds to a mail-session element in a deployment descriptor.
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Constructor Detail

      • MailSession

        public MailSession()

    • Method Detail

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription​(java.lang.String description)
        Sets a description of this mail session. Corresponds to the description element within mail-session in the deployment descriptor.
        Parameters:
        description - a textual description of this mail session
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.6: Mail Session

      • setName

        public void setName​(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the JNDI name by which this mail session will be registered. Corresponds to the name element in the deployment descriptor.

        The name must be a valid JNDI name, typically in the form java:comp/env/mail/MySession.

        Parameters:
        name - the JNDI name for this mail session
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.6: Mail Session

      • setStoreProtocol

        public void setStoreProtocol​(java.lang.String storeProtocol)
        Sets the protocol used for message store access. Corresponds to the store-protocol element in the deployment descriptor.

        Common values are imap, imaps, pop3, pop3s.

        Parameters:
        storeProtocol - the mail store protocol
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.6: Mail Session

      • setStoreProtocolClass

        public void setStoreProtocolClass​(java.lang.String storeProtocolClass)
        Sets the fully-qualified class name of the store protocol provider. Corresponds to the store-protocol-class element in the deployment descriptor.

        If not specified, the provider is looked up from the JavaMail providers configuration.

        Parameters:
        storeProtocolClass - the store protocol provider class name
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.6: Mail Session

      • setTransportProtocol

        public void setTransportProtocol​(java.lang.String transportProtocol)
        Sets the protocol used for message transport (sending). Corresponds to the transport-protocol element in the deployment descriptor.

        Common values are smtp and smtps.

        Parameters:
        transportProtocol - the mail transport protocol
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.6: Mail Session

      • setTransportProtocolClass

        public void setTransportProtocolClass​(java.lang.String transportProtocolClass)
        Sets the fully-qualified class name of the transport protocol provider. Corresponds to the transport-protocol-class element in the deployment descriptor.

        If not specified, the provider is looked up from the JavaMail providers configuration.

        Parameters:
        transportProtocolClass - the transport protocol provider class name
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.6: Mail Session

      • setHost

        public void setHost​(java.lang.String host)
        Sets the mail server hostname. Corresponds to the host element in the deployment descriptor.
        Parameters:
        host - the mail server hostname or IP address
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.6: Mail Session

      • setUser

        public void setUser​(java.lang.String user)
        Sets the user name for mail server authentication. Corresponds to the user element in the deployment descriptor.
        Parameters:
        user - the mail server user name
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.6: Mail Session

      • setPassword

        public void setPassword​(java.lang.String password)
        Sets the password for mail server authentication. Corresponds to the password element in the deployment descriptor.
        Parameters:
        password - the mail server password
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.6: Mail Session

      • setFrom

        public void setFrom​(java.lang.String from)
        Sets the default "from" address for outgoing messages. Corresponds to the from element in the deployment descriptor.

        This should be a valid RFC 822 email address.

        Parameters:
        from - the default from email address
        See Also:
        Servlet 4.0 Specification, Section 5.6: Mail Session
